remarks.para: One may be inoperative deactivated open provided the pack on the same side as operative valve is operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: With a Wing Isolation Valve deactivated in the open position the following Non-Normal procedures are modified. The new procedures are located in the AOM Chapter 2.1 and QRH. Ensure that the proper checklist for the deferred condition is used.
SMOKE AIR CONDITIONING - the changes affect which pack is turned off to isolate the smoke.
BLEED DUCT LEAK L, C or R - the changes affect closing engine bleed valves since one wing isolation valve is deactivated open.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to associated Wing Isolation Valve switch (overhead panel): "L/R WING ISLN VALVE INOP OPEN". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: The two isolation valves are installed in the pneumatic manifold aft of the air-conditioning bay. It is necessary to open the appropriate air-conditioning access door to gain access to the valves. To deactivate the isolation valve, you must put the valve in the open position and disconnect the electrical connector.

numlitem.para: Open the access door 191NL for the left isolation valve or 192NR for the right isolation valve (AMM 06-09-03/201).
Put the wing ISLN switch (P5 Overhead Panel) in the open position. Wait approximately 10 seconds for the valve to open.
Open and collar the associated P6 panel L ISO VLV AIR SUPPLY PWR or R ISO VLV AIR SUPPLY PWR circuit breaker.
Examine the position indicator on the actuator housing. If the position indicator is not in the OPEN position, turn the manual drive until the valve is in the OPEN position.
Disconnect, cap and stow the electrical connector from the isolation valve:
Remove electrical power if it is not necessary for other operations (AMM 24-22-00/201).
Close the applicable access door (191NL or 192NR).
